intro: Rhagodia preissii subsp. obovata, commonly known as the broad-leafed rhagodia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its robust, erect growth habit. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or red in color. Its leaves are broad and obovate, giving it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in arid and semi-arid regions.
